descriptionBlock.title: Can I help?
descriptionBlock.text:
Of course! There are several ways you can help:
  • Sponsors - with your help we can make our events truly awesome! From providing meals, through supplying cool ngGirls goodies - lots of opportunities to help.

faqs.question: Do I need to know anything about websites or programming?
faqs.answer: If you have some knowledge in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, you're ahead of the curve! If you are a beginner, we'll help you get up to speed!

faqs.question: I don't live in Kansas City, can I attend?
faqs.answer: Of course! We're so excited you're interested! Our selection process will factor your location to respect our local Kansas City sponsors, but we love meeting people from all over!

faqs.question: What equipment do I need to have?
faqs.answer: You'll need a computer with internet access, speakers/headphones, microphone, and a camera is optional. All required equipment is standard on a laptop.

faqs.question: Do I need to install something on my laptop?
faqs.answer: Yes, you'll need Angular CLI installed before the workshop, but we wouldn't expect you to install anything on your own. Join us for the install party Friday night so that you're ready to hit the ground running for the workshop.

faqs.question: I applied! When will I hear back?
faqs.answer: Yay! You'll hear back from us after June 30, 2020 after we have a chance to review all the applications.

faqs.question: I'm not a woman. Can I mentor?
faqs.answer: Yes! Everyone is welcome to mentor. We'd love to work with you!

partners.name: Ultimate Angular
partners.description: Ultimate Angular: Expert-led online Angular training courses

partners.name: JetBrains
partners.description: JetBrains is a cutting-edge software vendor specializing in the creation of intelligent development tools.

host.name: Kansas City Women in Technology (KCWiT)
host.description: We're trying to grow the number of women in technology careers in Kansas City.

posts.title: ngGirls comes to the Silicon Prairie!
posts.content: We're excited to bring ngGirls to the Silicon Prairie and looking forward to meeting participants soon!

posts.title: COVID-19 Advisory
posts.content: Your health and a safe learning environment are our top concerns. We appreciate your understanding and patience as we transition to an online only format.

mentors.name: Adora
mentors.title: Marketing Director
mentors.bio: Adora is a recent graduate from the University of Kansas with a background in Marketing and Anthropology. She loves learning and trying new things and building her passion and career around people, technology, and marketing.

mentors.name: Alisa
mentors.title: Program Director
mentors.bio: Alisa is a software architect, a former chemist, and a Navy brat who grew up in Japan. She enjoys volunteering, learning new things, and having a drink on her patio. She is a co-organizer of AngularKC and Technical Materials Director for Coding & Cocktails, a program that teaches women web development basics.

mentors.name: Ammaarah
mentors.title: Community Outreach Director
mentors.bio: Passionate about technology and politics, while bring my experience as a 1st Generation American.

mentors.name: Amy
mentors.title: Co-Director
mentors.bio: Amy is a graphic designer turned software developer who got her start in Kansas City Women in Technology's Coding & Cocktails program. She loves learning new things, cuddling her cat, and playing board games. She is also Co-Director for Coding & Cocktails, a program that teaches women web development basics.

mentors.name: Beth
mentors.title: Volunteer Director
mentors.bio: Beth is a self-taught web developer and loves all things geek, especially in the Star Wars and Marvel universes. When she’s not coding, Beth is traveling, binge watching Netflix, playing table top games with her husband and two kids, hitting up the gym and cuddling her German Shepherds.

mentors.name: Danielle
mentors.title: Attendee Director
mentors.bio: Danielle is an advocate for continuous learning and self-improvement, and is enjoying stepping into the world of technology and development and learning a lot along the way! She enjoys a nice glass of wine, a solid girls night, and getting a good workout in whether that’s on a yoga mat or in the weight room. Danielle loves KC, but STL will always be home.

mentors.name: McKenzie
mentors.title: Sponsorship Director
mentors.bio: McKenzie is a software engineer with a passion for puzzles, learning, and helping others get involved in technology. When not coding she is playing board games, reading, traveling, or knitting while trying to keep her yarn away from her cat.

mentors.name: Monica
mentors.title: Mentor Director
mentors.bio: Monica is a software engineer who loves to learn and share her knowledge with others. Aside from her passion for technology, she loves playing tennis, doing yoga, spending time with her family and friends, and exploring her favorite city, KC!

mentors.name: Jennifer
mentors.title: Founder, President KCWiT
mentors.bio: Jennifer is a self-taught full-stack javascript developer with a passion for technology and community building. She is also a GDE specializing in Angular and Web Technologies.

volunteers.name: How about you?
volunteers.bio: Become a volunteer and support the participants at our workshop. Just fill out the application form.
